title: How to write an informal thank you letter after an interview - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello! I am glad you are asking that question because many candidates are not taking this as an opportunity to separate themselves from the rest of the other candidates. If you follow up with the recruiter as well as the interviewers with a thank you note, you will be already ahead of some of the other candidates. To help you with this, my advice is to first jot down the names of the people who interviewed you and then afterwards, send them a thank you note. You could send them an email or a personalized thank you card. Overall, the objective is to show the interviewer you are interested in the position and appreciate their time. Be genuine about your message as well. Feel free to go here to find out more about this topic: http://www.myinterviewinsider.com/interviewthankyouletter/ Here is an example of a thank you email that you can customize to fit your situation: Thank you (insert interviewer name) for your time and consideration of me for the role of (list job here). I feel my skills, strengths, and experiences are a good fit for this position and I would bring my leadership, integrity, and execution (list any strengths you have worth mentioning) to the group. (list company) is a tremendous company with opportunities for me to grow and develop and am excited about the opportunity to be a part of a great team that can accomplish great things. It was a pleasure to meet you and if you have any further questions for me, please feel free to contact me at (insert contact info). Best regards,Your name I am glad you are making the time to separate yourself from other candidates! If you have any further questions or want to ask me directly, feel free to connect with me. I am more than happy to help you. This is my passion and I enjoy helping people succeed in their life. Talk to you soon,Jason Kor, Professional Interview Skills Coach and Founder of myinterviewinsider.com blog.

Here's a copy that has not failed me: Dear so-and-so, Thank you for taking the time for talking with me about the position. (Second sentence is all about something they liked or something you think you hit out of the park) I enjoyed our discussion about Hawaii and how beautiful it is there.... Anyways, just wanted to say thanks for your time and I look forward to hearing back from you. Cheers, Your name. The point is you always1. Thank them for their time2. Speak about something specific that they liked or you nailed (your informal part)3. Thank then again for their time and look forward to hearing from them4. Profit Hope this helps.
